comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Most likely Dimitri Rizow (also spelled Dimitrij, Dimitr, Dimitre, Rizoff, Risow, Rizov, ca. 1860 - 1918), the Bulgarian ambassador to Berlin from Mai 1915 to April 1918 (his dead because of a heart disease), see books.google.ch/books?id=qBZtGXYy_9kC&pg=PA83&lpg... (German) webopac0.hwwa.de/DigiJPG/P/14706/P147060005000000H_B.jpg (French) webopac0.hwwa.de/DigiJPG/P/14706/P147060004000000H_B.jpg (German)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
66311327@N05
comment._content: I agree, this is certainly the same man. The "Wirtschaftszeitung der Zentralmächte" says that he was born "around 1860" in Bitolja, Macedonia. The names are obviously written in very diverging ways.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: B-59 and artolog: Thanks for the information about Rizow (or Rizov, or Risow, etc...)  We can certainly add to the description regarding his career with what you have located.
